subject: Science
title: Neanderthals: Our Closest Relatives
description: A micro-lesson that makes Neanderthals: Our Closest Relatives usable.

hook.text: Neanderthals weren't stupid brutes. Their brains were actually bigger than ours.

buildup.text: They lived in Europe and Asia for 300,000 years, surviving ice ages and hunting mammoths.

discovery.text: They buried their dead, made tools, and may have created art and used language.

twist.text: When modern humans arrived in Europe 45,000 years ago, they interbred with Neanderthals.
